abilitygroupdescription.p: Abjuration involves the use of raw magical energies and focuses on casting protective, shielding and counter magics.

abilitydescription.p: This ability represents the knowledge of the theoretical foundations of abjuration. Expertise in this ability is a prerequisite for casting spells in this group. Players can check against this ability to answer questions about this field of study and its history.

Banishing is an attempt to disrupt a demons tenuous contagious connection with its simulacrum. If the banishment succeeds the demon must make a DC 7 Mettle check or its simulacrum is destroyed. In the event of an overcharge make Demon must make a second DC 3 Morale Check and make a DC 15 Willpower Check on, a fail the caster takes 2d4 damage, on a bane make an additional roll on the Magic Overcharge Effects table, on a boon the character may refresh a magic dice into their pool, snatched from the energy the demon is using to control their simulacrum.

A circle of protection is a circle drawn upon the ground and infused with magical energy that breaks thaumaturgic contagion. As such it is hard for summoned creatures to cross, either in or out. It takes about three turns to create a circle of protection. A circle of protection cannot be created while the caster is being attacked in melee.

If successful Creates a DC 25+5xRank protective barrier against extra planar creatures. To pass through the barrier the extra-planar character must roll above the DC using their Magic pool. Creatures striking the protective barrier will lose D4 hit points for each attempt.
The circle can be marked using chalk, salt, enscribed in the floor or a multitude of other ways.
It is possible to create an Inverted Circle of Protection which is usually called a Circle of Containment.

The caster creates a magical shield around a person, or anything tagged medium or small. The barrier from outside appears as a blurred humanoid shape. Kinetic weapons do half damage to the character thus shielded. It also provides brief protection from fires, poisonous gases . The shield is ablative and is represented in game by 8+3xRank temporary Staamina. It lasts five minutes/30 rounds.

If overcharged the shield may explode upon being hit, make a Std Check vs DDC 9 every time the shield is hit or explode. Explosions do 2d4 damage to all adjacent creatures including the character being shielded. Adjacent creatures may save, Speed or Dodge vs DDC 12, to take half damage.

Commune is a spell that communicates with a named entity from beyond. The character must know the name of the entity to contact. On overcharge the character must make an opposed will check against the demon or become enthralled by the demon. Enthralled characters will seek to summon the demons simulacrum to this plane to further their nefarious plans.
Summoned demons are not compelled to cooperate with the character, nor tell the truth.

The caster uses raw magical energy to knock arrows and crossbow bolts out of the air. The caster must be aware of the attack, not ambushed or surprised. The size of the missile that can be diverted depends on the rank of the casters ability. The missile does not have to be aimed at the caster in order for the caster to cast this spell. This spell is cast as a reaction after the target is hit, the caster can tell that the missile would hit and acts accordingly before it does.

The Flesh Ward spell provides magical protection for the caster against physical attacks, their skin knits itself up if they take damage. A Flesh Ward lasts the duration of combat and a character can only have one Flesh Ward active at a time.

In game the effect of flesh ward is represented in the form of a limited regeneration. If the cast succeeds, for the duration of the combat the character heals 1d4 hit-points every time they are hit, note that this does not mean every turn. If the cast overcharges the spell then the caster suffers damage equal to the difference between the DC and their roll.
